results.title: The Grapevine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
Two girls discuss of rumour that they have heard that their company is merging with another company which would mean moving to another city. On another occasion new office equipment is obtained and the rumour is spread that girls are being replaced by machines. The office manager when confronted with the stories says there is no truth in them. He has not been generous in answering questions and they were nervous about going to him. The question for discuss is how rumour can be prevented from being started.

results.title: The Grand
results.brief_description: Describes the work done by people of various backgrounds for conservation on the Grand River Watershed in Ontario, Canada. Also gives the background to the work and explains various methods of conservation used in the watershed area.

results.title: Goods traffic for Europe
results.brief_description: Every day some 15,000 goods trains transport their freights to and from the national and international markets contributing to the supply of thousands of European towns. In addition 14,000 passenger trains travel 600,000 miles daily carrying approximately 44 million people.

results.title: A Good beginning
results.creator_credit: Modern Management Films and Norwood Studios
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the right way to induct and train employees on new jobs. Seen through the eyes of a young girl hired to learn a data processing card-punch operation. Compares correct techniques with wrong techniques. Reminds supervisors of the need to relieve tensions in the new employee before useful training can begin.

results.title: Gone up north for a while
results.creator_credit: Paul Maunder, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A girl finds herself pregnant. She has no hope of marriage but knows that when her baby comes she will not give it up. She doesn’t know, but soon finds out, that society has no real place for her, and no understanding of the special needs of the unmarried mother and her child.

results.title: Goldilocks and the three bears
results.brief_description: The story of Goldilocks and the three bears, remaining faithful to the incidents and characterizations of the original tale. Suggestions for drawing pictures of the scenes of the story and for exploring other favourite stories provide children with an incentive for reading and artwork activities.

results.title: The Golden Jubilee of the CRB: Victoria 1913-1963
results.creator_credit: Jim Stirling and Country Roads Board
results.brief_description: Depicts 50 years of progress in road and bridge construction in Victoria. The first survey made in 1913 showed that travel was hazardous on the hand-made roads. In 1916 the first all-weather road to Geelong was completed. Gradually isolated settlers and mailmen were able to travel in the country. Municipal co-operation was sought and aid given for road construction by machines. Recent work includes new concrete bridges, and the completion of a two-lane highway from Melbourne to Dandenong, all important to Victoria’s prosperity. During 50 years, motor registrations increased from 10,000 to 90,000.

results.title: Gold is forever
results.creator_credit: Bob Talbot and Bob Talbot Productions
results.brief_description: A film designed to show the strains, stresses, dedication and training methods of marathon runners. Australia’s Derek Clayton features in the film. Highlights his great effort in the Munich Olympic Games, 1972.

results.title: God with a green face
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Ward, Myron Emery and American Society for Eastern Arts
results.brief_description: This colourful introduction to India’s greatest theatre tradition - the dance-drama of Kathakali features the Kerala Kalamadalam Company performing dances of the State of Kerala which have evolved out of the Sanskrit tradition and the indigenous Dravidian culture. The dancers display a great richness of costume, vivid colour and originality of head-dress.

results.title: God knows why, but it works
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Richard Mason and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The story of the life and work of Dr. Archie Kalokerinos. In nineteen years’ practice as the only doctor in the tiny western New South Wales town of Collarenebri, he has formulated radical treatments to combat the alarming health problems of the district’s Aboriginal population. This dramatised version of his life stars Henry Szeps, Robin Nevin and Peter Cummins.
